page.title: 16Life in Winston Today (ctd).
page.content: The village has only one shop and Post Office, but this is well-used by the inhabitants. As many people use the shop as travel to nearby towns to shop in supermarkets. The vast majority of families in Winston owns a car, for many travel to work from Winston, though a significant number, fourteen, works within ten miles of their home. Most homes have central heating, a telephone and a garden. The majority of households also own a pet, of which over half are dogs. Holidays are planned by 24 families for the coming year (1986), fifteen of which intend to holiday in the British Isles. The village also boasts two active churches. St. Andrew's congregation has many people who come from neighbouring parishes to worshp there.
